website_summaries.verdict: This small axe has a great design and an affordable price. It's an appealing deal for the budget-conscious.
pros: Works best for splitting and felling small trees
cons: Varnish must be removed from head and handle upon arrival

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS!!
customer_reviews.text: I loved the feel of and balance of this, but as you can see, it was not of the best quality. This happened the first time out splitting wood. I should also mention it sent me to the hospital with a 3 inch gash about an inch above my eye giving me a total of 14 stitches. If you want a good ax that won't give you a hospital bill, don't purchase this one.
customer_reviews.author: Fxg10

customer_reviews.title: Nice light axe
customer_reviews.text: Nice light axe. I removed the original lacker finish, and took down the "hump" in the back near the head. I refinished with boiled Linseed oil. The axe has a much nicer feel to it now. Again, It is a light axe, you won't be chopping down trees with or spitting lager logs with it, just some work around the fire or some branch removal. I bought it for a little project and to take camping without the worry of something happening to it. I have nicer axes but sometimes you don't want to bring them to campgrounds where they may walk off. ..if something happens to this one..its not the end of the world.
customer_reviews.author: RNR

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy axe
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size axe for the back of the Jeep or truck, or if you had to backpack carry, great chopper and splits smaller logs easy, the handle grain could be better and axe needs a bit of edge work as most state( this is ok with me) cons no sheath but for the price a quality axe overall, took it out and between me a buddy and his kid we went to town on everything from red oak, mazanita, tested it on some palm and eucalyptus edge took the beating very well if cold steel makes larger fire fighter pick axe I'd buy it aswell
customer_reviews.author: Ajax

customer_reviews.title: Really handy axe
customer_reviews.text: This axe was recommended by a youtuber I follow for being an excellent value. I was in the market for a small axe and this seemed the perfect fit for my needs. The handle feels great for the price, and the head is a useful shape. I will mostly use it for making kindling and light splitting, but I also bought a quality leather scabbard from the forestry supply so I can take it camping/backpacking where it will likely get pressed into general chopping and bushcraft. So far I am very happy with the axe and look forward to using it more.
customer_reviews.author: Batman97045

customer_reviews.title: Broke the first day . Dont waste your time
customer_reviews.text: Broke the first day . I used it for about 2 hours and the steel seems fine but the handle broke after only a couple of hours of use. I did not miss the log it wasn't a missed hit that went straight for the handle it was a clean chop. I took it camping and was very excited about this axe because of the great reviews. Should have listened to the 1 star reviews lol . Anyone doing some real chopping with this axe will be sorely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Luke A.

customer_reviews.title: Home run first axe
customer_reviews.text: Breathe in the fresh winter’s air... there’s something visceral about splitting logs in one swift motion. Then burning them for warmth and comfort. It’s good for a man’s soul. Get yourself this axe, good beard care salve, a sharpening stone, proper outerwear, good coffee & french press, some wood, and reclaim a bit of yourself. I recommend eating a hearty meal beforehand, but YMMV. Also, cancel your $2/mo gym membership. You never go, it’s a Petri dish of disease, and you know that place is awful. God bless
customer_reviews.author: BDawg90

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: Good steel. Proper grain orientation. Decently hung. This will give you all the form and function of the Gransfors Bruks offering IF you do the following (about 1hr of shop work) Grind off paint and lacquer from bit Sand off lacquer from handle Re-establish edge w/stone or belt Oil hickory handle (I prefer Sno-Seal wax) OR (for all of the function and less lumbersexual fuss) Re-edge with stone or belt Sand and oil hickory
customer_reviews.author: DemonstratedConceptsLLC

customer_reviews.title: Amazing axe for the money
customer_reviews.text: Cold steel rarely disappoints. I have a few of their products, and this one is just as good as the others. Again with my opinion on the Cold Steel Trailhawk, this comes with a heavy coat of paint, that I removed with some varnish remover. The first one I received came with a pretty decent split in the handle, which I was able to quickly return for another one. It took a really long time for Amazon to confirm that the old one was received, even though they sent out the replacement the day I submitted for the return, which arrived in the 2 day prime shipping period.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Miller

customer_reviews.title: NOT IATF legal!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this axe specifically for axe throwing leagues. I own a Cold Steel hatchet that I love. Given the companies affiliation with axe throwing, they should have noted that this is illegal. It is not free returns, making it not worth returning. I am hoping they offer a free return for an inaccurate web description. Guessing it is a nice axe for chopping. Cold Steel does make quality products, just my experience this go round cost me $30.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Decent Budget Axe
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these. They are NOT a Wetterlings or other high end axe by any stretch of the imagination. But they take and keep an edge fairly well. The handles have been an issue with both of mine, however. The grain doesn't seem to be running correctly, which leads to separation. The heads themselves though are good, and get most light to medium jobs done with minimal effort.
customer_reviews.author: JarheddTop Contributor: Golf

customer_reviews.title: The Metal Broke?
customer_reviews.text: We bought this in February 2018. Initially it worked amazing(hence the star). However, it broke just a couple weeks ago in September. Not sure why it lasted only seven months? Normally, IF an axe "breaks" (after years of use) the head will break off of the base. With this the metal at the head snapped in two. ???? defective? I tried to find an email or number to contact but couldn't figure it out so i thought I would just let y'all know. we bought it and the metal on the axe head broke after 7 months. :{
customer_reviews.author: melanie

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: The axe is great in the hand. I wanted a small forest axe that w asnt as expensive as a grandfors bruks and I got this which is comparable to the small forest axe. I sharpened it using a Lansky puck and it holds am edge nicely. One issue is that it comes with stickers and varnish on the whole axe including the head. So sanding is a must before you buy unless your fine with a barcode sticker on the handle
customer_reviews.author: Brandon V.

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: This is much smaller and lighter than I expected. Good for carrying around or in pack, but if you wanted to fell a tree - I would want something a few inches longer and at least 4 oz heavier head. But - wow. I can't even say how much I love it. I can carry this on my mountain bike and clear trees after a storm. People say they don't come sharp. I am not sure if my three orders are the only ones that came sharp, or if we have a different definition of sharp. Seems sharp to me. By the way, mine measures 27-3/8 inches OAL, including the head.
customer_reviews.author: Phönix

customer_reviews.title: Took some file work on the edge, but a great tool.
customer_reviews.text: As with many other customers my axe came with the need for some file work on the edge. I've come to expect that from Cold Steel though with their axes, hatchets and machetes. I got a good keen edge on it and then put it through it's paces splitting and shaping a smallish (6" diameter) hickory log for a project I'm working on. As with most Cold Steel products I've owned, this thing punches way above it's weight class. I didn't expect I could generate so much cutting power from such a lightweight tool. This axe will probably ride in the car when I'm not putting it to work.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Herring

customer_reviews.title: This axe is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this axe for cutting trails, backpacking & Bushcraft adventures. Out of the pacakge, (as with all axes) had to take a file and sharping stone to the blade. It does not come with a sheath, no biggie...for the price it is worth it to make one or buy one. That being said.....this axe is an angry little beaver! It chops like 3-4 lb axe, and doesn't quit! I chop cedar, mesquite, oak, and pine and it holds an edge quite impressive! This axe is outstanding and the price is amazing! If you know what your doing with an axe, you will be impressed!
customer_reviews.author: NavyGoat

customer_reviews.title: NIce axe!
customer_reviews.text: When I first picked up the box I thought "That's got to be a hatchet - No way that's an axe". After the box was opened I found a sweet little axe. Not a large wood splitting axe and a somewhat larger than a hatchet. Kind of a medival shaped head and super nice, straight handle. I tried it out limbing a tree. I'm really impressed! Much more effective than a hatchet but doesn't tire you out like an axe. It did have a rolled edge out of the box but it polished right out. Very nice axe - going to be handy camping, tree work, and just admiring.
customer_reviews.author: Terri

customer_reviews.title: Trailboss
customer_reviews.text: I have an older trail boss and bought 2 of the newer the new handles are a great improvement but you will still need to shape the handle and sharpen but this is true for all axes but this axe is a great value buy one learn to sharpen an axe and shape the handle and you will love it
customer_reviews.author: michael stice

customer_reviews.title: Keep the price low ;-)
customer_reviews.text: Yeah I know why price increases but take it from a marketer, keep up the quality and affordability. I literally hacked mesquite trees in a bad mood trying to break this thing and it just punished the trees. Don't forget to remove the laquer on the edge with a simple file or whet stone for a few seconds and chop on. Around here the seem to want to stock tons of Mauls. I ani't got time for that.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Bonny

customer_reviews.title: No reason not to have one
customer_reviews.text: The first one I received had some minor defects and dings in the axe head and the grain of the handle was okay but not great. I exchanged my first for another one, expecting the same quality but was completely surprised. The second one I received had perfect grain in the handle and no defects anywhere else. It swings great, it’s lightweight, it’s a great splitter and chopper and since it’s cheap it’s not a heartbreak if you damage it. Great axe for beginners to use and great axe for experts to enjoy or have as a backup.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Amazing axe for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Youtube channel Wranglerstar suggested this axe and he was amazed and I was also when II received it. I bought a so so scabbard for it that cost more than the axe. It is a beauty of an axe. Sand the varnish off the handle and put boiled linseed oil on it. When the handle gets dirty, wash it up and put linseed oil on again. I have several axes costing much more and this is the only one that is worth using.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff

customer_reviews.title: Amazing but not quite perfect
customer_reviews.text: This axe is great. Most of it was very sharp right out of the box. I had to do some work on the edge to get it to my liking. I also stripped off all the crappy varnish on the handle and put a couple coats of boiled linseed oil on it. It is very light and good for both chopping and more detailed work as well. Very impressed for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Steve94

customer_reviews.title: Terrible build, assembly and delivery.  Buy local save a headache
customer_reviews.text: It's probably not the worst axe you could buy, but it's certainly not the best. If we're to buy another, I'd spend just a bit more and probably be happier. The steel for the body of the axehead is extremely soft. I sanded out the imperfections on it .. yes.. with sandpaper. There is a visible seam where the steel for the blade is not fully welded to the body. Not to mention, it took FedEx 3-4 delivery attempts to actually deliver my package. I would have been better off buying an axe locally for all the headaches this was... which defeats the entire purpose of this
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 90% happy with the 1 I received
customer_reviews.text: Having read the reviews and watching YouTube reviews you should realize it’s a crapshoot... you could get lucky and then again maybe not... I’m about 90% happy with the axe I received... not too sharp and actually the cutting edge was rolled over but I’ve fixed that... also the handle is straight but the last 5” is slightly twisted a few degrees from the head... something I can live with and don’t i think it’s going to affect the way it functions
customer_reviews.author: not bill

customer_reviews.title: Nice carry and use axe for a good price.
customer_reviews.text: Cold Steel Trail Boss Axe is lighter than expected - handle is a lighter wood than shown which is probably usual - grain is a little off - will be testing soon - blade will need a stone sharpen before use - good price. NOTE: Style n Craft 98027 - Camper's Axe Sheath in Dark Tan Heavy Top Grain Leather - nice sheath that does fit the blade, however snap strap is not long enough to fit and secure on Cold Steel Trail Boss Axe
customer_reviews.author: Gray Whitley [+] PhotoJournal

customer_reviews.title: Best Buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Best handle of any ace I have ever owned. I’ve had GFB, Hults Bruks, Wetterlings, Councils, and others. This is by far the quality of hickory handle I’ve ever seen. It is super dense, with near perfect grain orientation, and no run off. The only complaint is the varnish on the handle and the paint on the head. Takes a while to get it all off. Very slight gap at the bottom of the eye on the bit side. Perfectly acceptable for a $30 axe. As with any non premium ace, you will have to put some time it with the bevel and sharpening the edge.
customer_reviews.author: James Joung

customer_reviews.title: Extremely happy with this
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I wanted a shorter handled and lightweight axe for camping and hiking. While I did refine the edge a little when I received it, it was pretty darn sharp to begin with. The first weekend I had it, I spent 3 days splitting 8 inch diameter cedar logs, and cutting those cedars down. With one handed use, I was easily limbing the tree and chopping 1 inch to 2 inch diameter limbs in half with one hit. I am a fan of Cold Steel products and this didn't let me down at all. I just wish I could find a sheath for it.
customer_reviews.author: RTT: Guns & Gear

customer_reviews.title: Junk handle
customer_reviews.text: Only used it lightly a couple times and the handle split all the way down. I had another wood handled cold steel tool and that didn't last either. Seems their "hickory" handles are cheap junk
customer_reviews.author: Jamie B.

customer_reviews.title: German style Axe on a Budget
customer_reviews.text: Phenomenal axe at this price point. You could easily purchase this and toss in the back of your truck or trunk for just in case, especially if you live in areas prone to trees and branches in the road. I opted to remove the lacquer and buff out the black paint. Whether you purchase as a simple axe or you want to a project, you cannot go wrong with this Cold Steel Trail Boss.
customer_reviews.author: Salty

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: I tried to save money by purchasing this axe. Don't waste your money. If you need an axe and want to go cheap buy a Fiskars. If you want an axe of quality, one that will last for years and years, an axe built by axe people for axe people....buy Gransfors Bruks, Holts Bruks or even Husqvarna. The edge on this axe came far from sharp. After sharpening the axe head came loose within 20 minutes of use. I was limbing an already felled small white maple. Absolute garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Steve K.

customer_reviews.title: decent axe
customer_reviews.text: good overall axe, someone liked my previous one more than I did so had to order another. axe could have been sharper but easily sharpened. the grain orientation could have been better but after a few uses it hasn't broke yet. the head fit was much better than my last one. would order again. stop painting the heads.
customer_reviews.author: bilker

customer_reviews.title: Over all best lightweight axe
customer_reviews.text: Working on steep terrain, having this light weight axe head saves your life when rugged terrain fatigues your body and stance. I've been using it over the last two months and it's cut low brush to 16" trees. Although it is versatile the axe's efficiency is severely decreased when it comes in contact with a hardwood tree's heartwood. The compacted pith is to dense for a lightweight axe head. Never used it as a sawyers axe yet but I'd give it a shot. I'd still buy another one just to have or as an emergency backup! Extremely versatile for all types of forestry and habitat jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality steel, nice handle
customer_reviews.text: Some people in the reviews are complaining about the handle being weak and the grain orientation being incorrect but the one I received is very nice and feels good to hold and swing. The axe head itself is a very hard but durable steel that isn't too hard to sharpen and holds the edge very well. The only thing that has happened to it was my fault because I tried to chop a small tree at a campsite and went all the way through the tree straight into a rock and took a nice size chip out of the blade. The rock did however break in half so the damage could have been worse.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Hailey

customer_reviews.title: Five stars because of the price
customer_reviews.text: Is it a Granfors Bruks or a Wetterling? No. But you're also paying a fraction of the cost of one of those axes for something that's well made and durable. The handle was surprisingly nice for something in this price range (and then some!), and while it didn't arrive as sharp as I prefer, it didn't take a lot of work to put a perfectly serviceable edge on it and it really seems to hold up well. For a bang-around campsite axe, you really can't go wrong with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Weezill

customer_reviews.title: Great camping axe
customer_reviews.text: Great little axe for camping. It is well made and holds an edge. I have 2 thst I bought at 2 different places. Both are very good quality and the wood grain is straight on the handle which means the handle was made correctly and will last. This is not an axe for chopping down a large tree but it is great for splitting kindling.
customer_reviews.author: Dakota

customer_reviews.title: Cold Steel Trail Boss Axe
customer_reviews.text: Used 3 times and the handle broke out of it! Worked wonderful after taking time to sharpen it properly as you should any axe. Love Cold Steel products normally- very disappointed that the handle snapped off a the head on the 3rd actual usage of this item- will get a new handle and repair but cant say I would recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: T. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Just what an axe should be.
customer_reviews.text: Why do they make axes heavier than this? I have felled trees and split wood with this axe. Heavier axes are harder to use but don't get the job done any better. I did put a full- length fiberglass handle on this to give me more leverage/speed on my swings. All wooden axe handles loosen pretty quickly, so that is to be expected and I didn't deduct points for it. Try finding another deferentially hardened axe head for this price. Good luck. Back when axes were the preferred method for felling trees, this was about the size they were. This is the size they should be.
customer_reviews.author: trail.biker

customer_reviews.title: Best deal available for the $$!
customer_reviews.text: This axe is great for a camp axe for the cost. I can't believe what a deal it is, holds a grate edge, lightweight enough to choke up & use a hatchet for trimmin & such. I polished the head to a chrome finish and put car wax on it. Laid out the handle in 12 inch increments, tied paracord 550 below the head to help protect & to have it ifin needed, made a leather sheath for the blade because its needed now! KingFish out-
customer_reviews.author: KINGFISH

customer_reviews.title: Durability stinks. Handle split after about 20 uses.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband for his birthday and I really wanted to like it. It was so light I felt like it would be great but the handle broke in half after 2 weekends at the cabin. The wood we have is pretty wet, maybe it would be ok for splitting already dry, small pieces but definitely did not hold up for us.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Hunsader

customer_reviews.title: Lifetime tool at an excellent price
customer_reviews.text: This is a sweet little axe that is a handy weight and size, is well machined, and is perfect for limbing and trimming. It is a well made tool at a bargain price, with time-proven design and competent execution. It is difficult to imagine how it could be improved for my needs. This was not razor sharp out of the package, but was lacquered and edge geometry was spot on. A couple swipes with the file and we were off to the races. Hangs great from a pegboard hook, but will need an edge guard. The minimal rubber guard was clearly for shipping only.
customer_reviews.author: RTfact

customer_reviews.title: Versatile AF!
customer_reviews.text: What a great little camp axe. My handle/neck did not immediately break like some of the reviews here... only leads me to believe they are not axe-ing correctly! lol. Used so far in splitting 2 cords of wood, plenty of kindling, and bushcrafting and still going strong. Would 100% buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff kornowski

customer_reviews.title: Good lightweight axe
customer_reviews.text: I've used this a lot. It's a good lightweight axe that takes and keeps an edge pretty well. I used it to chop free a chainsaw that was pinched and stuck in a tree. I ended up hitting the bar 3 or 4 times chipping the edge of the axe pretty severely. Within 30 minutes I had the edge reground and sharpened (using a worksharp); and now you can't tell it was ever damaged. This is a very good small axe, perfect for camping and light. And the price is great.
customer_reviews.author: Huckleberry

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Axe!!!
customer_reviews.text: 25 bucks? This is a lot of axe for this price. The hickory handle is outstanding. The head and handle are perfectly hung. This will need some sharpening, but that's not a big deal and to be honest, expected. It's not a 150 dollar Swedish axe, but, oh yeah, 25 BUCKS! I expect years of service from this cool axe. I'll be making a leather blade guard and handle protector. Very good light weight axe which I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: GrecoAmericano

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: The handle broke in less than a month, but I used duck tape to hold it together. I still use it and enjoy it, and love the feel and thickness of it. But it broke quite quickly. This was also a replacement. The first broke at the head. Would not buy again except for playing as novices
customer_reviews.author: Michael Smith

customer_reviews.title: Nice axe!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this axe. Based on reviews I thoroughly checked the handle for any signs of damage or cracking. Mine looked good and cut well with a few hard trial strikes. The handle grain looks great on this one. After removing the polyurethane from the hickory handle I flame scorched it and sealed with boiled linseed oil.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this to split firewood (Oak). Works great, came sharp. Smaller size when compared to a full size ax I feel helps me keep it under control when chopping. Warning!!! pay attention when splitting wood! Being sloppy and not paying attention when chopping with this (and any axe) will send you to the ER with it planted in your shin! Spent about 2-3 days splitting firewood held up great. Blade still sharp, handle and head still solid.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: The mediocrity is strong in this one
customer_reviews.text: By far the poorest quality Cold Steel product I've ever purchased. There is a rather large knick on the bottom corner of the head just inside the black coating. Worked the sharp edges down with a file and sandpaper. Wasn't even close to being shaving sharp right out of the box like they tout in the videos. (Yes, I did remove the clear lacquer before checking sharpness). Mediocrity is not something I expect from Cold Steel. Definitely not worth the price. Maybe half that.
customer_reviews.author: Beagle

customer_reviews.title: Good, but needed some work.
customer_reviews.text: They mailed me a dull axe. Seems unusual given Cold Steel’s usual quality and sharpness. The edge it arrived with could be bounced off an open palm without fear. It also bounced off of dead ash limbs when swung with intent. Half an hour’s work with a file and sharpening puck was necessary to bring it up to a usable edge.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: nice
customer_reviews.text: after reading some of the negative reviews was hesitant about ordering, handle was near perfect and a nice job hanging the handle, have sanded the handle and got rid of the varnish, going to use linseed on the handle, is a great axe for 30 bucks, will serve my use. I recommend and I would and will order again, thinking about ordering for my son in laws as Christmas gifts. it comes dull but a few minutes with puck and is sharp.
customer_reviews.author: rft

customer_reviews.title: My new go-to axe
customer_reviews.text: I was a nervis given cold steel's recent QA problems and reading sone reviews. But gave rhis axe a thorough inspection. Everything is solid. Nice little axe handles nicely and splits surprisengly well. Only complaint I have is the cheap paint on the axe head and the finish on the handle. Just not for me, but will be removing both soon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT for the proce
customer_reviews.text: Literally the best axe ive seen in this price range! -a nice hefty hickory handle with good grain alignment -a medium carbon steel axehead that, if treated well can hold a good edge for a while -its the same price as some you cam receive from the hardware store -The blade geometry is pretty awesome when it comes to blade width and making the most of a light head
customer_reviews.author: Akiva M.

customer_reviews.title: Great little ax
customer_reviews.text: Great little ax. Can be used by a full sized man for a long time, the light weight is only a minor hindrance in this case. For an older small woman, this ax can be used for a decent period of time without strain because of the light weight. Once you've used the blade or sharpened it, the plastic coating over the blade will be removed and the blade will rust readily. Make sure you keep it oiled. I just bought a leather sheath from here and once I stretched it to size, I just put a little oil in the sheath and hasn't rusted since.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Doest have a sheathe.
customer_reviews.text: Grain of the real hickory handle is lined up nicely with the head, came sharp. Has a wierd gloss finish on the head to prevent rusting but it doesnt seem to affect the chopping characteristics. Love this thing its just ganna sit in the back of my car for whenever i need it.
customer_reviews.author: casey

customer_reviews.title: Was the quality control inspector asleep?
customer_reviews.text: Was the quality control inspector asleep? The grain quality on the wood handle is quite a bit less than I was expecting. There is absolutely zero-reason why quality vertical-grain handles cannot be selected prior to being installed into an axe heads at the factory.
customer_reviews.author: EbbTide

customer_reviews.title: Great little camp axe
customer_reviews.text: Great little camp axe. Used it a lot this summer to cut down split logs for outdoor fires. Handle feels very sturdy and fits well in my hand. I made a leather sheath to protect the axe head and make it safer to travel with. It fits perfectly under the seat in my truck when its not on my back pack. Perfect weight to hike with and takes the place of my Becker B2 for splitting duties for fires and some trapping. Came out so sharp that I was a little worried about accidental cutting. I would recommend it to anyone for a handy axe to have. It has some limitations with bigger logs but thats to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: Ejstew

customer_reviews.title: Good quality axe, great price!
customer_reviews.text: Well made axe. Orientation of the grain in the wood handle is perfect. Axe head steel seems to be of a high quality, and came with a pretty sharp edge. Have not used it yet, but I will be going on a one month camping trip in about three weeks, and I will be using it daily. Length of the handle is just about perfect for doing wood splitting at camp. I have several hatchets with shorter handles for the smaller branches, and I have another axe with a longer handle for chopping down dead trees for use in camp. This one should fit a niche that I needed to fill.
customer_reviews.author: William Pysell

customer_reviews.title: Great axe. If you can sharpen it...
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy is you can’t re-grind. You cannot simply sharpen this axe, you will have to file the edge down to a point. It comes insanely dull. If you are able to put en edge on this bad boy it’s the best exe ever. The steel holds a fantastic edge and the handle is perfectly designed and comphortable. If you want to make this axe better I stained the handle red and sanded off that coating the put on the axe head and polished it. Looks gorgeous.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: One of the best blade making companies for the budget minded
customer_reviews.text: Let me start with saying cold steel makes some of the most robust budget tools for any enthusiast of blades out there, got mine for car camping and winter bushcrafting. Comes pretty sharp but you need to remove the enamel coating on the edge with sandpaper or a flap disk or else it will gum up your axe head when splitting. Bare metal cuts through better than butter. Handle is American hickory and excellent quality as well.
customer_reviews.author: Johnah

customer_reviews.title: Affordable packable axe best buy.
customer_reviews.text: After immediately returning the 1st one this replacement was enroute and delivered in a couple days. Easiest return ever and this axe came perfect. The returned axe had multiple defects in the handle; a couple of cracks and poor grain orientation. The replacement has perfect grain, head is set beautifully, and it feels well balanced. Now I need to chop with it. If it holds up to real use this is an incredible buy @ under $30.
customer_reviews.author: im2scary

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money.
customer_reviews.text: If you know how to sharpen axes, this one is really good with a little extra fine tuning of the blade. I wish the handle had a little more curve at the base of the handle for my ergonomic comfort. Overall a great ace for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Skylor Alexander

customer_reviews.title: A Great First Axe For a Novice of Tree Felling
customer_reviews.text: For years I've wanted a good hatchet/axe and I finally picked up this Trail Boss to cut down some standing dead's around my property as well as split firewood. The very first day, without sharpening, I was able to cut down a newly dead Oak in my back yard in just a few hours. The next day I did the same with two more trees. The third day, with the assistance of a chainsaw, I cut it all up and split it into firewood. This axe is extremely comfortable and sturdy and just feels right in the hands. It is worth far more than the price-point and is an amazing buy.
customer_reviews.author: Flynn Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Decent axe for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've never owned an axe before this, so I don't have any reference point on build or quality. It feels very comfortable whether you're using one hand or two. I feel like I have very good control of the head. You'll probably want to sharpen the blade out of the box. With that said, I haven't had any issues with performance. I bought it to chop wood for my smoker and that's what it does. Others have complained about rusting, but I have not had any issues with that. Overall, I'm happy with the purchase and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Actually Worth It.  Nice Axe.
customer_reviews.text: This little axe is a TREMENDOUS bargain! I saw it reviewed on Wranglestar YouTube channel and bought one based on his review (Cheapest Axe on Amazon was the video title). It PERFORMS! Nice and sharp with a great feel! I’ve used it several times for clearing my local trails and it’s fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Bussiere

customer_reviews.title: Good value.
customer_reviews.text: The craftsmanship for the price is rather impressive. It essentially copies Swiss and German style bits. I bought this as a cheap replacement for a terrible Mexican made Collin's axe for my father. Does an okay job at felling soft woods and as a camp axe. I wouldn't do any splitting with this axe, it's a bit thin in the cheeks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Handle Alignment
customer_reviews.text: Given the price point and other reviews, I was pretty sure this was going to be hit or miss. In my case, the handle was installed twisted by 15-20 degrees, as well as being off center. I'll reorder and try again. If you do get one, it's a super axe for the price.
customer_reviews.author: aTypicalEngineer808

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful High Quality Axe
customer_reviews.text: I was really surprised in the craftsmanship and quality of this axe. I bought it to use in tree felling, primarily for driving wedges for which it seems a little too light. However, I can see where it would be a super camping axe much better than a hatchet. I like it but I should have bought a heavier head.
customer_reviews.author: 04rk88

customer_reviews.title: Worthless handle
customer_reviews.text: The axe head itself seems alright. It sharpened fairly easily. I was excited to go use this but as i was leaving i noticed a crack along the grain of the handle near the bottom. Upon closer inspection i found 2 more cracks. These aren't little cracks that can be ignored. A couple swings into a tree and i am sure the handle would break. I am surprised my axe passed inspection. It seems Cold steel focuses on quantity of products rather than quality.
customer_reviews.author: Mackenna Fuller

customer_reviews.title: This little axe is perfect for trimming and even small tree cutting
customer_reviews.text: This little axe is perfect for trimming and even small tree cutting. It is light enough to swing with one hand for me or for my wife to use. She's 5' 2". I had been cleaning up a new lot with a chainsaw and a machete, this is the ideal middleman. It took a bit of getting used to, I was swing much harder than necessary at first. I really like the broad head for a bigger cut. I wish I had found this sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Ascnbe

customer_reviews.title: Great tool cheap tool
customer_reviews.text: Typical cold steel, cheap, could use a few thing, but for the price i wouldn't change a thing still came sharp, is a little smaller than i thought, but for a new axe at this price it but it again for 30$
customer_reviews.author: Thereviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great handle, good head, great double pin attachment, good quality steel
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after seeing it reviewed on Wranglestar's uTube channel. Not dissapointed. The way the head is secured to the handle is excellent. The quality of the steel is good and it holds an edge. The quality of the handle and the choice of wood grain is above expectations and very good. There is essentially no sheath so plan to make or buy one. And plan to tune the edge a bit to get the right profile though not bad out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Hartranft

customer_reviews.title: Super ax!
customer_reviews.text: A well built product. This is something I've come to expect from Cold Steel. I have many products from this company NONE have ever disappointed me. Great build, good steel, grey function and usability.
customer_reviews.author: Duane Treat

customer_reviews.title: Solid Axe Head and Handle
customer_reviews.text: I own a small camp axe and wanted to upgrade to a larger axe head and handle. Reviewed several options and selected this axe based on the reviews. Balance of the axe head, quality of material all appear good. The blade cover was damaged in shipping but it was not my intention to keep it anyway. Recycled. Overall, well pleased with the quality/price.
customer_reviews.author: PURDUE98

customer_reviews.title: A NICE CAMP AXE
customer_reviews.text: In my humble opinion, this is a great little axe for the money. It's not a splitting maul, for sure, but it had no problem splitting kindling for my fire. The cutting edge was nice and sharp. The handle is a nice piece of hickory with good grain. The sheath that was recommended to go with it had a strap that was too short, but I added a piece of boot lace to extend it and it works fine ( see pic ).
customer_reviews.author: David Gresham

customer_reviews.title: Best lightweight axe for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Great axe head that strikes deep into wood. Even after many missed swings from months of use during winter, it holds an edge quite well. The handle also stays strong and is easy to hold onto. It's comfortable and very lightweight. A little better suited to felling trees than splitting logs. But it will split logs well.
customer_reviews.author: Joshman

customer_reviews.title: Great small ax at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Great small ax - feels good in the swing and come fairly sharp. Handle has a good smooth finish that does not cause blisters. Just right for small saplings and limbing. Too small for big trees and too big for kindling. Just right for everyday chopping
customer_reviews.author: Shane Simon

customer_reviews.title: Nice camp axe but not a heavy chopper!
customer_reviews.text: Really nice axe but be aware it is not a heavy chopper, more of a medium duty axe, but none the less, a quality axe with nice hickory handle, for the money I would buy it again. Also know some users experienced loosening of the axe head when using it hard.
customer_reviews.author: True Review

customer_reviews.title: Arrived in Damage packaging and the tip was chipped
customer_reviews.text: I'll update this review once I've tried it out. But axe arrived chipped with damaged packaging, thus the 4 starts. The blade of the axe had a rubber cover which was cut through and the box and a cut threw it from the axe head where it cut through the rubber guard. So when the axe was in transit, the head must have gotten slightly damaged. I've tried to sharpen it, and i don't think it'll be an issue so I'm not returning it.
customer_reviews.author: GeorgeBoteaIII

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Tool
customer_reviews.text: Really liked the weight of the axe; great balance and is a great quality for a novice or intermediate user. Especially handy for splitting kindling. Was purchased as a gift for a young man. This tool will last him a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: intheWood

customer_reviews.title: Great ax for the money
customer_reviews.text: Ax sharpens easily and holds an edge, the handle was oriented correctly, would have liked if the handle was oiled, but the finish sanded off easily. Worth well more than the $30 dollars. Cold steel should offer a sheath but the Helko Werks case fits great in medium
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Small yet powerful. Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: The axe is excellent. Small enough to be portable but very sharp and durable. I went camping right after getting this and 8 dudes put it to work hacking away and basically a whole tree for firewood. It held up and kept on cutting. It split beautifully and I’m excited to care for it and see how it holds up over the years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pictures tell the story.
customer_reviews.text: I beat the hell out of it, first thing. Then decided it could take it. So, I made it mine. Sharpened it, sanded it and stripped it. Waxed the handle, brushed out the head, then carved a mask and neck guard. Money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Frank ledbetter

customer_reviews.title: It works for what it is intended for and seems to keep a good edge, so good quality steel
customer_reviews.text: this is a medium/small axe. It works for what it is intended for and seems to keep a good edge, so good quality steel, but it is so small and light that one's muscles are doing all the work, and when chopping up trees it is easier for me to use something a bit weightier and let gravity do the work. if a light axe is something you need/use/know how to use, then this is a well made one
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: perfect truck axe
customer_reviews.text: Great little cutter, my truck axe, keep it behind the seat, has came in handy, not a full size, but if you know what your doing, you can make it work for an all around chopper, would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Worldly Consumer

customer_reviews.title: A great "axe:
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than a normal axe, larger than a hatchet. It has a sharp blade and good construction. Other reviews complained of the handle breaking easily. This was not my experience. It did eventually break, after I threw it over a hundred times. It works well as a throwing axe, also.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: A great looking axe that breaks
customer_reviews.text: A great looking axe with some heft. I was encouraged by the reviews it had for a cheap axe. However, after two days of solid wood chopping, the hickory handle broke. I know how to chop efficiently, it just could not take it. Needs a better handle.
customer_reviews.author: D. R. Strumlok

customer_reviews.title: Handle broke WITHIN the head of the ax the second time I used it...
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used this ax I was only using it to make kindling. The second time I used it I was chopping small longs (3 to 5 inch diameter) into smaller sections. After I cut the first log into three pieces, I went to the next log and within the second swing, the ax head broke off the handle and bounced up and fell nearly a foot away. Works good for kindling but not so good on chopping actual logs or small trees.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Poor handle quality and extremely early failure
customer_reviews.text: The head of the axe is pretty decent and sharpened well, although I broke the handle in 4 camping trips just using it as a fire ring hatchet with some small limb splitting. The head is probly good enough to re hang but with a handle costing $20+ youd be better off buying a whole new axe and saving the labor. Grain orientation was okay but there was a larger amount of heartwood which is where the failure occurred.
customer_reviews.author: brock

customer_reviews.title: ... backpacking combined with my Sven saw I have a great wood processing arsenal
customer_reviews.text: I also bought this for backpacking combined with my Sven saw I have a great wood processing arsenal. The Trail Boss is very well made and if not misused it should last as long as some expensive brands. I stripped the veneer clear coat off the handle and put multiple coats of boiled linseed oil on with plenty of dry time between coats, and it also brought out the natural grain in the hickory looks pretty good. Then I stripped of the clear coat off the leading edge of the blade and put a little better edge on it with a Lansky Puck , splits wood like a pro and makes me look like I know what I am doing.
customer_reviews.author: kyle

customer_reviews.title: Broken on the second log
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this axe for light splitting around my home. The handle snapped on the second log I split, splintering into my hands. One of the worst purchases I have ever made on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Liz C

customer_reviews.title: Great camp ax
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had mine very long,but have taken it out back and played...er...worked with it a bit,just to see how it performed. For the short time I've had it's worked out great. Not too big,not too small sizing,sharp out of the packaging,and seems well built (it's from Cold Steel,I would expect no less),and the pricing was right. It had no problems falling a couple of 5-8" diameter hardwoods,or clearing up some deadfall. For the price,I highly recommend it. I DO wish it would have came with a sheath (even knowing this would raise the price a bit),but that's a nit that really isn't in the same cart to pick,so I digress :p
customer_reviews.author: Stephen S.

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed at all
customer_reviews.text: Handle broke, axe came with what appears to be a crack
customer_reviews.author: Mima

customer_reviews.title: Lot of bang for the buck!!!
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery, nice head with a decent edge. A couple swipes with a file made it shaving sharp. My handle was great, grain was more than expectable all though I'm sure not all are but who would buy an axe head for the handle....nobody in there right mind at least. The best thing is the price to quality, it just can't be beat by any other axe maker. Don't listen to all the complaints cause those are people that nothing makes them happy. They want a $200 axe for $25....dream on. Thank you for the excellent axe I really appreciate it and the fast delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Billy

customer_reviews.title: Wished it would have held up better than it did. . .
customer_reviews.text: Initial thoughts were the axe was great for the price. Good weight and balance, seemed pretty solid. Unfortunately after the third time using it, the handle split right under the axe head to almost the center of the handle. And this was just chopping some smaller pre-cut logs into serviceable pieces. I've returned it via the Amazon Return Policy and am having another one sent out. Hopefully the last issue was just a fluke and this one holds up a bit better.
customer_reviews.author: Borzak21

customer_reviews.title: Great axe for price
customer_reviews.text: Great handle and balance. Great tool for the price. Not to big or heavy to put in your belt and go for a walk in the woods. Holds an edge. Carry a puck and always take a minute on all my tools edge. Makers a clean deep cut. Splits wood well.
customer_reviews.author: darry johnson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome. Just awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Literally nothing that you could say bad about this axe, not even considering how little it costs. Great size for light duty chopping, camp use, trail use, and back-of-the-truck use.
customer_reviews.author: James in AZ

customer_reviews.title: disappointed. they used to be better.
customer_reviews.text: the handle was far thinner than expected. i've seen many reviews of how wonderfully thick the handles were on these, but it was so thin it hurt my hand. never even got to chop with it. just held it for five minutes and returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew R.

customer_reviews.title: It’s exactly what I wanted and expected.
customer_reviews.text: I looked over the axe very carefully when it arrived today. The total quality is perfect. The grain on the handle is perfect, the head is square and perfectly mounted. It feels great in the hand. Unless there is a hidden defect that shows up somewhere over time, I’m pleased with what I bought.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne Grogan

customer_reviews.title: Great value for a camp axe.
customer_reviews.text: Great value for a quality camp axe. Bought it after watching Wranglestar's YouTube video. It was fairly sharp right out of the box. It is not designed for felling large trees. Works great for de-limbing branches, cutting down small trees and brush, and spitting firewood for kindling. The steel is of good quality and the hickory handle has the wood grain running correctly for a strong axe handle.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Excell

customer_reviews.title: Best ax for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Good steal. Good handle wood with tight grain in the strongest direction . The ax is not too heavy and the handle is the right length for most applications . Price is very reasonable for the quality .
customer_reviews.author: jhkey65

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly stout axe
customer_reviews.text: Extremely happy with the Trail Boss. Very nicely shaped handle, though the grain orientation is not ideal. Head is very well proportioned and seems to be good quality steel. Good balance, swings well and bites hard. Overall, I'm very impressed and would not be at all unhappy if I'd paid significantly more for it.
customer_reviews.author: H. Clausen

customer_reviews.title: Great for what I use it for
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for over a year now and the axe head holds up great. Slight wobble after all the abuse I put it through but nothing a wedge wont fix. Takes a nice bite out of whatever I'm chopping. I would say with the weight of the head it would be good for trees 6"-7" and under. Anything over you're starting to waste energy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Cold Steel All-Purpose Axe with Hickory Handle, Great for Camping, Survival, Outdoors, Wood Cutting and Splitting

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
